meanings.definition: To put a new jacket on something.
meanings.sent1: She rejackets her favorite book to protect it.
meanings.sent2: He rejackets his phone to give it a fresh look.
meanings.sent3: The cat tries to rejackets the mouse toy, thinking it's a real mouse.
meanings.sent4: The artist rejackets the canvas with vibrant colors, transforming it completely.
meanings.sent5: Rejacketing the sofa in a bright fabric instantly brightens up the room.

meanings.definition: To cover something with a new jacket.
meanings.sent1: The student rejackets the textbook to keep it clean.
meanings.sent2: They rejackets the old chair with a cozy blanket.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally rejackets the cake with too much frosting.
meanings.sent4: The snow rejackets the town in a blanket of white, creating a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent5: Rejacketing the car in a shiny coat of paint makes it look brand new.

meanings.definition: The act of putting a new jacket on something.
meanings.sent1: Her rejackets of the worn-out jacket made it look stylish again.
meanings.sent2: The rejackets of the books in the library added a pop of color.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy's rejackets of the toys scattered them all over the room.
meanings.sent4: The rejackets of the forest in autumn colors was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent5: The rejackets of the room in a fresh coat of paint brightened up the space.
